oai_dc:dc.dc:title: John Coffee portrait
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John Coffee (1772-1833). Small portrait from the shoulders up. He wears a dark coat and lighter vest, with a white shirt and necktie. His hair just barely curls over the collar. Top two buttons of the vest are unbuttoned.
General during the War of 1812, John Coffee was an early Nashville settler and surveyor. Later relocated to Alabama.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Coffee, John, 1772-1833
Coffee, John, 1772-1833;Creek War, 1813-1814;United States. Indian Removal Act of 1830
Pioneers;Surveyors;Generals
